newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- off 1/4, new issues arrive.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- off 1/4, new issues arrive.

text.p: U.S. municipal bonds were off about 1/4 point in the cash market, following the Treasury market lower.
The long bond was off 13/32 at 98-22/32 to yield 6.73 percent.

The May Consumer Price Index rose 0.1 percent overall and increased 0.2 percent in core, versus estimates for gains of 0.2 pecent in each. May housing starts were down to 1.397 million units versus forecasts for 1.47 million.
Munis on Monday were up about 1/8 to as much as 1/4 point in spots in light action.
Munis "did not go up on the good news, but there is not a lot of selling pressure right now," one trader said.
The market is following new issues, the trader said, adding that he suspected that prices would "hang in around these levels."
The market has been looking for supply.
Sales for this week were expected to total $4.3 billion in 160 deals, according to Reuters Municipal Bond Information Group.
Negotiated offerings added up to $3.2 billion in 73 sales, the largest total this year, and on the competitive side, 87 sales totaling $1.1 billion were scheduled.
Lehman Brothers tentatively priced a $111 million New York State Mortgage Agency deal through Lehman Brothers. The offering came at a 5.85 percent top yield in 2028 in the preliminary pricing.
Also in the primary market early Tuesday, Houston, Texas, saw $103 million of airport bonds priced with a 5.80 percent top yield in 2017.
Smith Barney tentatively priced Loyola University, Ill.'s $188 million of bonds with a 5.60 percent top yield in 2024.
Actively quoted issues on Tuesday included Dade County, Fla., water and sewer system FGIC 5-1/4s of 2026, which were bid down two basis points from Monday at 5.49 percent.
Jefferson County, Ala., FGIC 5-3/4s of 2027 were bid at 101-1/4, down from 101-3/8 on Monday.

September municipal futures were off 10/32 to 117-25/32, while September Treasury futures were off 12/32 at 111-22/32. The MOB spread between the two contracts widened to 195 ticks from 193 at the close on Monday.
